Calendar Infiltration
Syncs with Google Calendar, Outlook, and whatever your company uses to ambush you. Identifies gaps between meetings where you won't be missed.
Ambient Threat Detection
Monitors Slack activity spikes, email velocity, and badge-swipe patterns to calculate when the coast is actually clear.
Escape Route Mapping
Learns your building's blind spots. The second-floor bathroom that nobody uses. The fire escape that's technically not for breaks. The supply closet with the broken lock.

I built this because I had a panic attack in a glass conference room and fourteen people on the other side of the glass kept eating their lunches. I watched them not look at me. Or maybe they did look and then decided not to. I don't know which is worse.


After that I started timing things. How long between meetings. How long the bathroom on the third floor stays empty. How long you can sit in your car in the parking garage before someone from facilities knocks on your window. I put all of that into a spreadsheet and the spreadsheet became an algorithm and the algorithm became Kekku.


I didn't set out to build a product. I set out to answer one question: when can I be alone? Turns out a lot of people are asking.

— Miles Vex, founder
